translation1: "All Bosch electric tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to the strict controls of Bosch's quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a warranty for Bosch electric tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments. This warranty does not limit the defect claims of the buyer from the purchase contract with the seller or any legal rights.For these tools, we provide a warranty according to the following conditions: We provide a warranty in accordance with the following regulations (No. 2-7) by free repair of defects in the tool, which are demonstrably caused by a material or manufacturing defect within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, for commercial or professional use or equivalent use 12 months.The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first end user. The relevant date is the date on the original purchase receipt. For all blue electrical tools and measuring tools purchased on or after September 1, 2004, and intended for commercial use (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery drills, and pneumatic tools), the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the purchaser registers these tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date.Battery packs and chargers, as well as accessories included, are excluded from this extended warranty. Registration can only be done online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). The confirmation is considered the registration receipt, which must be printed immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt from which the date of purchase is evident.Registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of the data to be entered there. Excluded from the warranty are: parts subject to wear and tear or other natural wear, as well as defects in the tool caused by use, abnormal environmental conditions, unauthorized use, overloading, or lack of maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of accessories, add-ons, or replacement parts that are not Bosch original parts.Tools, on which changes or additions have been made. Minor deviations from the specified properties, which are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The elimination of the defect recognized by us as warranty-bound is carried out in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (if applicable also with a successor model).Replaced tools or parts become our property."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "3", "Explanation": "The text is moderately fluent with noticeable errors that may slightly affect comprehension. For instance, parts of the text are not clearly structured leading to complicated and long sentences (e.g., 'For these tools, we provide a warranty according to the following conditions...'). The wording is at times stiff and causes the text to sound unnatural (e.g., 'This warranty does not limit the defect claims of the buyer from the purchase contract...'). Moreover, the use of 'we' is not always consistent with 'Bosch' which can confuse the reader (e.g., 'are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to the strict controls of Bosch's quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a warranty... For these tools, we provide a warranty...'). Overall, while it is possible to understand the content, the fluency can be enhanced." } }

translation1: "Tire choice for racing bikes - really so risk-free? This morning I woke up full of motivation to prepare for my upcoming bike tour, and I at least wanted to train a little bit. Said and done, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay.The first 40km were really nice - but then it happened, what lurks in every city center (this time: thanks Krefeld!). Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire refused to participate in the rest of the journey on any account.As I couldn't really get a replacement jacket and inner tube on account of the day of the week, I had to turn around again and take the first train back home with a somewhat bad mood. Then it wasn't technically so bad either, maybe it's even better if I practice the tire change again before the bike tour. But now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.As I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would really rather not have this problem often. Now it wasn't too bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (very nice old gentleman, who had ridden 120km on them by the time I picked up the bike) were also described as suboptimal, because he had been riding on them for several years. But if I think about having to replace the tire after 80-90km of riding, I'm afraid I'll be in a really bad mood :DI then got into a conversation with an older man at the platform, who asked me in surprise why I didn't have the Marathon Plus tires; they are supposed to be flat-resistant, don't they? Now the whole thing naturally sounds very tempting. But are they really so indestructible?I have little desire now to spend 40€/tire just to be disappointed in the end. Furthermore, I ask myself: I believe I have 25x622 on my racing bike at the moment, which seems to be available (apparently?) with the Marathon Plus tires, but the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you advise me to go for other tires on a racing bike in general? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! The experts seem to recommend the Durano DD more?Thank you in advance for the help and kind regards!"
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent, with no grammatical errors or unnatural wording. All sentences read smoothly and convey clear meaning, including complex sentences. Despite the text's casual conversational tone, the correct use of punctuation, grammar, and vocabulary enhances its comprehension." } }

translation1: "\"Party, which we wanted to throw\": Frankfurt celebrates after scoring a comeback against Leverkusen. What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt! After 22 minutes, the Hessians, who had lost their last two games in a row, seemed to be on their way to another Bundesliga defeat.But then the SGE turned it on, got rid of their frustration from a mixed start to the season within an hour, and won furiously with 5:2. \"It's crazy what the guys did today,\" coach Oliver Glasner exclaimed on DAZN and gave a \"blanket praise\" to everyone involved. At first, it looked like another disappointment for Frankfurt, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had put Leverkusen ahead 2:0.What then happened also impressed the SGE coach. \"How the players then came back and showed a fantastic performance\", so Glasner further. I am incredibly happy with the performance we showed and of course also with the result.Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to play again for the first time since the fourth game day and overcame his muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I believe our mentality is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old, looking forward to the result, especially for the spectators. That was the party we wanted to throw today.For the upcoming tasks, Glasner wants to keep the focus within himself, but he is also well-prepared in terms of personnel. It is extraordinary that we have all players fit in December, that all players are physically in top condition. It is top work in our medical department, but the players also live a highly professional lifestyle.No one wanted to \"go step by step and remain humble\" and carry out the tasks until the end of the year \"at this level\". Next up is an away game in English week on Wednesday at Borussia Mönchengladbach (6:30 pm, Sky)."

translation1: "Problems with glass fiber + Devolo DLan/Magic We have had a new glass fiber connection in the house for a few weeks. Unfortunately, I am now having trouble building a stable WiFi network.Before, I had a 50 Mbps DSL connection and used Devolo DLan, which received and transmitted 50 Mbps flawlessly, except for a few failures. The new fiber optic connection sends 500 Mbps to the FritzBox 7590 and at the DLan module attached to the FritzBox, these are also received. However, at the other DLan module that transmits WiFi, I no longer receive the full 500 Mbps, but the more I move away from the module with the socket (which is located in 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module), the less I receive.This results in the Internet being slower in the first floor with the new fiber optic connection (~45 Mbit) than before. I also ordered a new Devolo Magic Set, which apparently uses a new technology. This was slightly better than the DLan, but there were also similar losses.Could someone explain to me why so much internet speed is lost with fiber optic cable through the power line, and is LAN really the only solution? translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, which among other things has led to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly emulates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we are presenting a completely new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers offer an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Even these amps, of course, contain the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier. This is based in part on real analog circuits because they simply better capture the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system from which the natural resonances simply burst forth.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound like you've always imagined. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the VOX Valve Reactor technology introduced in 2001. Of course, it has since been refined several times to meet new sound requirements, which in 2010 led to a performance boost for the VOX Valvetronix series - with more dynamics and numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the compact VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed so that all guitarists looking for maximum sound variety will find what they are looking for. All guitarists dream of the pressure and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, a nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and a quick response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the output stage in particular determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit of every VT+ amplifier, equipped with a 12AX7 tube, perfectly reproduces the behavior, the subtle nuances, and the sound character of a tube amplifier."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is extremely fluent in English. The language used is appropriate for the context, there are no grammatical errors or awkward phrasings, and the sentences flow into each other naturally, making it easy to understand." } }

translation1: "Federal Minister of Building Klara Geywitz: The expropriation does not create any new apartments. The new Federal Minister of Building Klara Geywitz (SPD) has spoken out against the expropriation of large apartment conglomerates, as has been demanded in a Berlin popular vote. \"With an expropriation, not a single new apartment is created, it only changes the structure of ownership,\" Geywitz said in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the coming years. By the way, a colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing companies is actually the best protection against the formation of a monopoly. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission to deal with the outcome of the referendum.However, if the situation does not improve, Geywitz is not ruling out talks with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of rental regulations. The coalition agreement provides for a rental price brake until 2029, a limitation of rent increases in tight housing markets, and the expansion of the rental mirror. I will speak with the Minister of Justice to implement this as quickly as possible.If the rental market still doesn't loosen up, \"we will talk to our coalition partners about further steps\", emphasized the SPD politician."

translation1: "I am fed up with Sky Sport F1. Hello dear F1 fans, over the course of the season, the quality on German Sky has deteriorated more and more, so I want to vent a bit with this post. First of all, today during the F2 race, the broadcast was interrupted to start the F1 pre-coverage on time.Although the delayed start and the starting accident disrupted the schedule, it was still possible to show the last ten minutes (planned) and the championship decision. Apparently, however, legal reasons give F1 priority, and therefore everything else must be restricted, which is why Sky DE had no choice. Nevertheless, it's stupid, especially since Sky UK broadcasted the entire race.Nonetheless, a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartjes has well accompanied the difficult situation around the heavy accident. Then there was again a lack of knowledge of the rules among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although there was already such a situation in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the decision that Verstappen can change tires when there were corresponding radio messages about Hamilton.At Sky UK as well as RTL, both commentators immediately knew that there was this possibility for Verstappen. I am of the opinion that such basic rules should simply be known when commentating on F1 at a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first time that now, according to the rules, something that is possible or required is a puzzle. Both have constant uncertainties about the rules.Generally, I don't like Roos's artificial commentary style, but I acknowledge that it's a matter of taste. However, I find Heiko Wasser from RTL even more serious. Additionally, there are constant sillinesses that make both of them appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The latter brings a lot of unrest in the commentary, as he clearly does not take it seriously. Advertising simply takes over at Sky, as can be heard in the out lap, where Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as can be heard on F1TV, where only the German sound track without commentary is sufficient and must be played directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Both of these broadcasters also make less advertising in training than Sky, and that as a free-to-air broadcaster. However, one must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone does not overlook the disadvantages. The rest of Sky Sport F1's program is also very meager and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is really the worst German-speaking broadcaster that broadcasts F1. Ironically, RTL does a better job except for the advertising during the four races they are still allowed to broadcast. Thus, the magnificent F1 season is much less fun than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster.I would like to hear your opinion."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text can be considered mostly fluent. It uses proper English grammar and syntax for the most part, and although it is somewhat informal with a conversational tone, it is not ungrammatical or incomprehensible. However, there are a few minor issues. For instance, 'and must be played directly after the race' is somewhat unclear or vague in context, and 'that now, according to the rules, something that is possible or required is a puzzle' is a bit awkwardly phrased. Despite these small issues, the overall meaning of the text is clear and can be understood without difficulty." } }

translation1: "Basketball Bundesliga: Derby disaster for MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim. At least one youngster, Johannes Patrick, held up. Again nothing: for the second time in less than three months, the giants lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach, John Patrick, had said with regard to the cup defeat at the beginning of October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim: \"We still have some anger in our stomachs.\" However, this did not subside after the game, but rather increased in light of the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. Although the bare result was disappointing, what was even more disheartening was the manner and style of the team's performance.A substitute statistic expresses the whole dilemma: The three-point shot percentage was only 13 percent, 4 shots (all from young John Patrick) out of 31 attempts - any questions? John Patrick answered: \"We were not concentrated enough after the win in Tenerife and did not implement what we trained for, namely moving the ball.\"His counterpart, Sebastian Gleim, reacted very differently: \"It was awesome to win the game for the second time against Ludwigsburg,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" Although only 750 visitors were allowed on Saturday in the Hohenlohe Arena, they made the most of it.Not least also because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led his team's game. \"The best playmaker I've ever trained,\" praised Gleim again. While in Patrick's team, even the key performers like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) underperformed.Only in the last quarter (22:15) the giants prevented a complete rout and came within eight points after they had already trailed 39:59. Besides Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also scored twelve points. Fortunately, there was not much time for complaining.Already on Wednesday (at 8 pm) the Giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt, then also in Ludwigsburg a maximum of 750 spectators."

translation1: "Heavy \"Huidlerer\" question: Amberger knows the solution What exactly is a \"Huidlerer\"? With this dialect word, sent in by an Amberger, the BR television program \"Wir in Bayern\" has caused intense reflection.But unlike on many previous days, the term in the \"Host mi?\" series remained unguessable for the callers this time. No, it was not \"a person who is nervous\". And neither was it \"someone who must everything go quickly\".As, heard the people from the TV moderator, is completely wrong. Whereupon the man from Amberg provided the solution and thus probably also caused astonishment among many people from the Upper Palatinate. \"The Huidlerer,\" the viewers learned, \"is a rag with which someone wipes the oven.\"Dialect researcher Antony Rowley, who has been consulted as an expert by Bavarian television for years, confirmed this. With the remark that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, derived somehow from the better-known dialect word \"Houdern\". Thus, a gap in education was closed - probably also for many who have lived in the Amberg area for a long time."

translation1: "Friedrich achieves 60th World Cup victory - Nolte wins in the two-man bob - Sports The brand of Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 successes is the goal of the bobsleigh pilot. \"I've calculated that, I would have to average nine and a half victories per season, then I could achieve it by Cortina 2026,\" said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who recorded two successes in two days at the races in Winterberg.First, he repelled Johannes Lochner's attack by 0.5 tenths on Saturday, moving up from third to first place. Then he made some adjustments to the material settings and on Sunday, he drove 0.30 seconds ahead with a larger lead. With his team consisting of Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg), and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat the British driver Brad Hall.Third was the Austrian Benjamin Maier. \"We took a bigger risk today and were rewarded,\" said Friedrich, who also brought in his 22nd win in a row. Johannes Lochner from Berchtesgaden, who drives for Stuttgart, finished fifth this time after previously coming in second.Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach finished in eighth place after ranking fourth in the first race. \"If I knew what he was doing differently, I would do it too,\" said Lochner. Nolte won with a home victory, and Jamanka earned a podium finish.On her home run, Laura Nolte collected her third season win in the two-woman bob at the women's event. After only managing fourth place the day before in the monobob, she stormed to victory on Sunday as part of Germany's triple triumph with pusher Deborah Levi in the World Cup. Two-woman bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen finished second with the fastest sprinter in Germany, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen.She recorded, in addition to her Olympic qualification, her first podium finish this winter. The Wiesbaden woman Kim Kalicki finished third with Leonie Fiebig. For me, it was super cool, first podium finish in the World Cup, I am super happy that Mariama takes me along.I am very pleased with the development. There is still a lot of potential at the start, but the start times today were okay,\" said Burghardt and emphasized: \"It's not just pushing, there's also a lot to do around it\". Jamanka was a little annoyed about the not entirely error-free rides, but said: \"It's going in the right direction\"."
